related_questions.question: What does Ativan do to you?
related_questions.snippet: As a tranquilizer, Ativan can make the user feel calm and physically relaxed. Ativan can also stop painful spasms in muscles, or prevent life-threatening seizures when taken correctly. For patients who take Ativan as directed for legitimate reasons, this medication is generally safe and effective.
related_questions.title: Ativan (Lorazepam) Side Effects, Overdose, and Withdrawal

related_questions.question: What is Ativan most commonly used for?
related_questions.snippet: Lorazepam is used to relieve anxiety. Lorazepam is also used to treat insomnia caused by anxiety or temporary situational stress. Lorazepam is in a class of medications called benzodiazepines. It works by slowing activity in the brain to allow for relaxation.
related_questions.title: Lorazepam: MedlinePlus Drug Information

related_questions.question: Is Ativan a sedative or narcotic?
related_questions.snippet: What are Benzodiazepines? Benzodiazepines are depressants that produce sedation and hypnosis, relieve anxiety and muscle spasms, and reduce seizures. The most common benzodiazepines are the prescription drugs Valium®, Xanax®, Halcion®, Ativan®, and Klonopin®.
related_questions.title: Benzodiazepines - DEA.gov

related_questions.question: Is Ativan the same as Xanax?
related_questions.snippet: Ativan and Xanax are both benzodiazepines used for the treatment of anxiety, and both are equally effective for this use. The differences are: Xanax has a quicker onset of effect, but a shorter duration of action (4 to 6 hours) compared with Ativan's 8 hours.
related_questions.title: Ativan vs Xanax - What is the difference? - Drugs.com
